title: I Just Created 5 Expensive-Looking Pre-Spring Outfits from Zara, Mango, and Nordstrom—You're Welcome
description: Outfits for everything from a wedding to brunch.
excerpt: Outfits for everything from a wedding to brunch.
text: (Image credit: Zara, Mango, Nordstrom)Spring is just around the corner, bringing a wave of new arrivals to online shopping destinations like Zara, Nordstrom, and Mango. As I browsed these three, several expensive-looking items instantly caught my eye.No matter the season, these sites are always my first choice for finding the perfect balance of luxury-inspired pieces without the hefty price tag. For spring, the fresh collections have inspired me, prompting me to create a collection of outfit ideas to share, hoping to inspire anyone looking to refresh their wardrobe this season. Whether you're searching for an outfit for the office or a wedding, there's something for everyone. Keep scrolling for five pre-spring outfit ideas and to shop for each piece.Outfit #1(Image credit: Nordstorm, Zara, Mango)You might want to live in this outfit this spring, and I don’t blame you. It’s not only super chic but also perfect for a variety of occasions, including brunch with friends, date night, an evening at the museum, and even the office. The dark wash blue jeans and white boatneck tank top provide an excellent foundation. The burgundy suede jacket on top adds just the right amount of warmth, while the snakeskin-printed heeled mules provide height, and the perforated East-West bag completes the look with style. Open Edit Boat Neck Sleeveless Top Levi's Ribcage High Waist Wide Leg Jeans MANGO Animal-Print Sandals MANGO Die-Cut Faux Leather Shoulder Bag Outfit #2(Image credit: Mango, Nordstrom, Zara)If you're looking to elevate your spring work outfits, this is the perfect place to start. The gray trousers, paired with a matching cropped jacket, exude professionalism, while the blue striped button-down adds a refreshing twist to the classic white blouse. And those black flats? They're not just any flats; they're sleek and sophisticated with their pointed toe and rounded vamp. Though the mini navy suede bag might not hold your laptop, it brings a stylish touch that enhances your look, especially when paired with your larger work bag. MANGO Crop Suiting Jacket ZARA 100% Wool Straight Leg Pants Zw Collection Nordstrom Scarlet Pointed Toe Flats MANGO Suede Mini Shopper Bag Outfit #3(Image credit: Nordstrom, Zara, Mango)No pre-spring outfit guide is complete without featuring a trench coat or white jeans. This outfit merges both elements, showcasing wide-leg jeans from Nordstrom paired with a funnel-neck trench coat from Mango. The airy green blouse introduces a vibrant touch and a sense of lightness thanks to its gauzy material, while the black flats adorned with gold embellishments add a contrasting, edgy finish to the ensemble. MANGO Oversized Cotton Trench Coat MANGO Combined Blouse With Bow Details 1822 Denim High Waist Wide Leg Jeans Schutz Jodie Slide Sandals Outfit #4(Image credit: Zara, Mango, Nordstrom)One of the biggest trends for spring is bubble-hem shorts, so I had to create an outfit around them, specifically featuring a new style from Zara that I guarantee will sell out within the week. Since it’s usually not that warm during the early months of spring, I paired the shorts with a lightweight cardigan. I opted for beige suede sandals to maintain a warm neutral color palette and sculptural bangles to add some interest and personality to the casual look., ZARA Smooth Knit Polo Jacket ZARA Zw Collection Balloon Shorts ZARA Suede Toe-Loop Sandals MANGO Set of 3 Combined Bracelets Outfit #5(Image credit: Mango, Nordstrom)Wedding season is upon us, and if you’ve received a flood of invites but have nothing to wear, I have an affordable yet elegant outfit idea for you. Consider Mango's new black maxi dress, which makes a subtle statement with its ruched design throughout the body, chic asymmetric neckline, and elegant draping in the back. Given the dress's sophistication, style it simply with diamond stud earrings, a black leather shoulder bag, and strappy heels. This look can take you to a black-tie wedding in New York City or an outdoor celebration in Spain. MANGO Side Slit Draped Dress Open Edit Remington Ankle Strap Sandals ZARA Metallic Detail Shoulder Bag Nordstrom Cubic Zirconia Stud Earrings Nikki Chwatt is an associate fashion editor based in New York City. She joined Who What Wear in 2024 after writing fashion, beauty, and lifestyle content for WWD, Well+Good, Editorialist, and more. With a passion for personal style and the creativity that comes with it, one of Chwatt's goals is to help others understand that there is no such thing as a “good” or “bad” style; it’s just about putting an outfit together that makes you feel confident in yourself. When she's not writing, you can find her taking a Pilates class, reading a powerful romance novel, or exploring a new wellness spot in Manhattan.
html:
Spring is just around the corner, bringing a wave of new arrivals to online shopping destinations like Zara, Nordstrom, and Mango. As I browsed these three, several expensive-looking items instantly caught my eye.

No matter the season, these sites are always my first choice for finding the perfect balance of luxury-inspired pieces without the hefty price tag. For spring, the fresh collections have inspired me, prompting me to create a collection of outfit ideas to share, hoping to inspire anyone looking to refresh their wardrobe this season. Whether you're searching for an outfit for the office or a wedding, there's something for everyone. Keep scrolling for five pre-spring outfit ideas and to shop for each piece.

Outfit #1

You might want to live in this outfit this spring, and I don’t blame you. It’s not only super chic but also perfect for a variety of occasions, including brunch with friends, date night, an evening at the museum, and even the office. The dark wash blue jeans and white boatneck tank top provide an excellent foundation. The burgundy suede jacket on top adds just the right amount of warmth, while the snakeskin-printed heeled mules provide height, and the perforated East-West bag completes the look with style.

Open Edit

Boat Neck Sleeveless Top

Levi's

Ribcage High Waist Wide Leg Jeans

MANGO

Animal-Print Sandals

MANGO

Die-Cut Faux Leather Shoulder Bag

Outfit #2

If you're looking to elevate your spring work outfits, this is the perfect place to start. The gray trousers, paired with a matching cropped jacket, exude professionalism, while the blue striped button-down adds a refreshing twist to the classic white blouse. And those black flats? They're not just any flats; they're sleek and sophisticated with their pointed toe and rounded vamp. Though the mini navy suede bag might not hold your laptop, it brings a stylish touch that enhances your look, especially when paired with your larger work bag.

MANGO

Crop Suiting Jacket

ZARA

100% Wool Straight Leg Pants Zw Collection

Nordstrom

Scarlet Pointed Toe Flats

MANGO

Suede Mini Shopper Bag

Outfit #3

No pre-spring outfit guide is complete without featuring a trench coat or white jeans. This outfit merges both elements, showcasing wide-leg jeans from Nordstrom paired with a funnel-neck trench coat from Mango. The airy green blouse introduces a vibrant touch and a sense of lightness thanks to its gauzy material, while the black flats adorned with gold embellishments add a contrasting, edgy finish to the ensemble.

MANGO

Oversized Cotton Trench Coat

MANGO

Combined Blouse With Bow Details

1822 Denim

High Waist Wide Leg Jeans

Schutz

Jodie Slide Sandals

Outfit #4

One of the biggest trends for spring is bubble-hem shorts, so I had to create an outfit around them, specifically featuring a new style from Zara that I guarantee will sell out within the week. Since it’s usually not that warm during the early months of spring, I paired the shorts with a lightweight cardigan. I opted for beige suede sandals to maintain a warm neutral color palette and sculptural bangles to add some interest and personality to the casual look.,

ZARA

Smooth Knit Polo Jacket

ZARA

Zw Collection Balloon Shorts

ZARA

Suede Toe-Loop Sandals

MANGO

Set of 3 Combined Bracelets

Outfit #5

Wedding season is upon us, and if you’ve received a flood of invites but have nothing to wear, I have an affordable yet elegant outfit idea for you. Consider Mango's new black maxi dress, which makes a subtle statement with its ruched design throughout the body, chic asymmetric neckline, and elegant draping in the back. Given the dress's sophistication, style it simply with diamond stud earrings, a black leather shoulder bag, and strappy heels. This look can take you to a black-tie wedding in New York City or an outdoor celebration in Spain.

MANGO

Nikki Chwatt is an associate fashion editor based in New York City. She joined Who What Wear in 2024 after writing fashion, beauty, and lifestyle content for WWD, Well+Good, Editorialist, and more. With a passion for personal style and the creativity that comes with it, one of Chwatt's goals is to help others understand that there is no such thing as a “good” or “bad” style; it’s just about putting an outfit together that makes you feel confident in yourself. When she's not writing, you can find her taking a Pilates class, reading a powerful romance novel, or exploring a new wellness spot in Manhattan.
